metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Learn to create HTML animations using JavaScript.
content.html: Learn to create HTML animations using JavaScript.

content.text: To demonstrate how to create HTML animations with JavaScript, we will use a simple web page:
content.html: To demonstrate how to create HTML animations with JavaScript, we will use a simple web page:

content.code:
My First JavaScript Animation

My animation will go here
content.code_html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<h1>My First JavaScript Animation</h1>

<div id="animation">My animation will go here</div>

</body>
</html>

content.text: All animations should be relative to a container element.
content.html: All animations should be relative to a container element.

content.code: My animation will go here
content.code_html:
<div id ="container">
  <div id ="animate">My animation will go here</div>
</div>

content.text: The container element should be created with style = " position: relative ".
content.html: The container element should be created with style = "position: relative".

content.text: The animation element should be created with style = " position: absolute ".
content.html: The animation element should be created with style = "position: absolute".

content.code_html:
#container {
  width: 400px;
  height: 400px;
  position: relative;
  background: yellow;
}
#animate {
  width: 50px;
  height: 50px;
  position: absolute;
  background: red;
}

content.text: JavaScript animations are done by programming gradual changes in an element's style.
content.html: JavaScript animations are done by programming gradual changes in an element's style.

content.text: The changes are called by a timer. When the timer interval is small, the animation looks continuous.
content.html: The changes are called by a timer. When the timer interval is small, the animation looks continuous.

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* code to change the element style */

syntax_highlighting.text: /* code to change the element style */

content.code_html:
id = setInterval(frame, 5);

function frame() {
  if (/* test for finished */) {
    clearInterval(id);
  } else {
    /* code to change the element style */ 
  }
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* code to change the element style */

content.text: Create the Full Animation Using JavaScript

content.code_html:
function myMove() {
  let id = null;
  const elem = document.getElementById("animate");
  let pos = 0;
  clearInterval(id);
  id = setInterval(frame, 5);
  function frame() {
    if (pos == 350) {
      clearInterval(id);
    } else {
      pos++;
      elem.style.top = pos + 'px';
      elem.style.left = pos + 'px';
    }
  }
}
